description.en: Born as an aa of Lord Mahea (iva), the sweet or lucid instructor of the principles of non-dualism, the Sun in dispelling the dense darkness (the great delusion), the preceptor of the six cults, merged in Supreme in the thirty-second year of his life span, in the Kali era 2625 on the eleventh day of the bright fortnight in the month of Vabha of the year Raktki. This venerable ri akarbhagavatpda established the Advaita school everywhere after winning over the scholars (of rival schools) through commentarial works on Brahmastra etc. His native is Kerala; belonged to Nampthiri group; father was ivaguru, mother rymb, preceptor - ri Govindabhagavatpda, life span - 32 years; realisation - on the eleventh day of the bright fortnight of the month Vabha in the year Raktki of Kali era - 2625 in Kci itself.

description.en: A native of Gauadea, born in Kashmir, pious, ri Surevara, secured the knowledge of Prva Mms from Kumrila bha, well-versed in Vedas, and avowed to house-holders life; he engaged in debate with crya and got initiated into asceticism. Then, attending on crya, he reached the highest level in yogic practices and by the directions of the crya, he lived forseventy years at the Kmapha in Kci. Then, in the year 2695 of the Kali era, on the night of the twelfth day of the bright fortnight in the month of Jyeha of the Bhava year that revered Surea, having taken the world by surprise through his fame by traversing throughout the earth, united/merged with the Supreme Being in the path known as Laya obtained the state of beautiful form of ivaliga verily in the presence of on-lookers.

description.en: This Sarvajtman, who was born to Vardhana got initiated into asceticism even before the age of seven by ri akara himself on being delighted to have had debate with him on the banks of river Tmrapari; he spent seventy years along with Surevara in that Pha and then lived in that Maha for forty two yearsThe sage known as Sarvaja attained union with his own Self by doing service at the lotus feet of ri Padmapda, who  was  dear  to  the  crya  (ri  akara) and imparting the unparallel doctrine through Cinmudr to the saint by name Brahmasvarpa who served with love and faith at the feet of the master who (Sarvaja or Brahmasvarpa? - Not clear from sentence construction) was holding the pontiff-dom of the Dvravat maha.The sage Sarvajtman whose works such as Sakeparraka showed clearly/elaborately the collective meaning of the words hidden in the great commentatorial works on Advaita merged in the Supreme on the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight in the month of Vaikha in the Nala year of the Kali era 2737 at Kci ri akara Maha.

shlokas:
AmrAvatItaTajatANDavazarmasUnuH zrIsatyabOdhaniyamI phalinIzanAmA.
zrIbhASyavArtikakRdAdarasamprapannasarvajJasadgururavODha dhurAM gurUNAm..10..
abdAn yastattva(96)saGkhyAn avasad adhi maThE zAradAnAmni kAJcyAM
dRpyattautAtitArhajjinagurukaNabhukpazyadaGghryAditantram.
niryantraM nirmimANaH padakazatahatArAtikautaskutOktiH
sAkSAcchrIsatyabOdhO'kRta sahabahulASTamyahE nandanE svam..11..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: The saint Satyabodha, by name Phalina (before initiation into sainthood), son of Tavaarma living on the banks of mrvat river, the noble preceptor, who authored commentatorial and Vrtika texts on Advaita Vednta bore the responsibilities of preceptor. Then, r Satyabodha, who lived for ninety six years in Kci in the Maha called rad, making unrestrained the systems of haughty Kumrila, Buddhists, Jains, Prabhkara, Kada and Akapda and having shattered the enemies by the text Padakaata realised his Self on the eighth day of the dark fortnight in the year Nandana.

shlokas:
jAtO maGgalanAmni cOlaviSayE nAgEzasaMjJAd dvijAcchrIjJAnOttama ityavAptabirudO yastArkikAgrEsaraH.
jJAnAnandamunistriSaSTizaradaH sammaNDya pIThIM gurOH siddhiM manmathamArgazIrSasitasaptamyAm avApatsudhIH..12..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Born of a brahmin called Ngea in the village called Magala of the Chola country, the erudite saint well-known as r Jnottama, foremost among logicians, having adorned the Pha of preceptors for sixty-three years, attained salvation/siddhi on the seventh day of the bright fortnight in the month of Mrgara of the year Manmatha.

shlokas:
vEdAraNyajavaidyabharvutanayaH zrIvizvanAthAbhidhO jJAnAnandamunEravApya niyamaM kAJcIpadE sthApitaH.
zuddhAnandamunIzvaraH sa zaradaH saikAmazItiM dhurAm AcAryasya vahannavApa ca nalajyESThAcchaSaSThyAM layam..13..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: r Vivantha, son of Vaidyabharva of Vedraya, received initiation from sage Jnnanda, became uddhnandamunvara was established in Kc; having carried on the responsibilities of the preceptor for eighty-one years, he secured union on the sixth day of the bright fortnight in the year Nala.

shlokas:
AnandArAddhagaurIniravadhikaruNAlabdhasAhityavidyA-
sauhityaH sUryanArAyaNamakhitanayazcErabhUzcinnayAkhyaH.
AnandajJAnanAmA bhagavadupapadaH sambabhau bhASyakartuH
pIThE zrIkAmakOTyAM prakaTitaparamAcAryabhASyaughabhASyaH..14..
zuddhAnandamunIndracandravimalAlOkAstacEtastamAH
vistAryAdvayavartma saptatimathO naikAM samA gAmavan.
zrIzailAntikam Asadan pathivazAd AnandasiddhiM yayau
siddhaH krOdhanarAdhakRSNanavamIsandhyAmanu brahmavit..15..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: A native of Chera country, son of Sryanryaamakhi, by name Chinnaya, having secured excellence in Shitya by the infinite or immeasurable or unbound grace of goddess Gaur, who was pleased with worship, the sage by name nndajnan prefixed with the term Bhagavat the author of a collection of expository texts on the works of crya, lived in the Kmakoi Pha of the crya, the author of a commentary on Brahmastras. This accomplished knower of Brahman having got rid of the ignorance by the immaculate splendour of the moon-like uddhnandamunndra, spreading the path of non-dualism protecting the world/earth for sixty-nine years, then approaching rail, on the way, attained blissful liberation on the ninth day of the dark fortnight in the month of Rdh (Vaikha) of the year Krodhana.

shlokas:
zrIzailIyazivayyasUnuradadhAt tasyAjJayA tat padaM maGgaNNArya iti zrutaH paramahO kaivalyayOgiprathaH.
ArUDhaH zivarAjayOgapadavIM tiSThaMstryazItiM samAH siddhO'bhUt sa ca sarvadhArimakarakrAntau ca sAyAhani..16..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Son of ivayya of raila, known as Manganna, held that position by his directions and became well-known as Kaivalya Yogi, ascended to the status of a Rjayogi and remaining (in that position) for eighty three years accomplished realisation in the evening of Makarasakrnti of the year Sarvadhri.

shlokas:
AndhrESvAtmaNasOmayAjitanayO gargAnvayO gaGgayA-
bhikhyaH khyApitaSaNmataH zivahariskandAdisEvAdhvani.
tantrAcAravidUramEva paritO vEdaikamArgOditaM
saMsthApyAdvayam apyadhAd dvayakathAdUraM kRpAzaGkaraH..17..
zrIkaivalyamunIndrazAsanavazAt zrIvizvarUpAbhidhaM zRGgEryAM nihitaM vidhAya niyamAn lOkE vyavasthApya ca.
catvAriMzatam Ekayuktam abhimaNDyAcAryapIThIM dizaM prasthAyaiDaviDasya siddhimabhajadvindhyE kRpAzaGkaraH..18..
vibhavE vibhurUrjitaH parOrjE paramApAnutRtIyam advitIyaH.
paramaM padam AtmanInamEkaM paramAnandamayaM parAparAkhyam..19..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Kpakara, son of tmasomayji in Andhra in the lineage of Garga, with the name Gagayya before initiation established six religions of worship in worshipping iva, Hari, Skanda and others away from Tantrik practices and establishing everywhere the non-dualism enunciated in the Vedas, drove away the notion of dualism. Kpakara established r Vivarpa at geri under the directions of r Kaivalya Munndra and formulated precepts; having adorned crya Pha for forty-one years, he departed in the direction of Kubera, viz. North and attained siddhi at Vindhyas. The mighty omniscient (Kpakara), the One without a second, attained the supreme non-dual state of the Ultimate known as parpara which is full of Supreme Bliss on the third day of the dark fortnight in the month of Krtika in the year Vibhava.

shlokas:
mahAbalIzvarEzvarAcyutOdbhavO mahEzvarAbhidhaH surEzvaraH parO niyamya sarvabhUgurOH.
avApa kAJcikAmakOTipIThadhUrvahakriyAM yayau svam akSayE'kSayaM zucEH zuciH sa parvaNi..20..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Born of Mahbalvarevara by name Mahevara, the other Surevara, adhering to austerities obtained the responsibility of governing the Kci Kmakoi Pha of the preceptor of the entire earth, He, the pure reached his imperishable state in the month of ha of the year Akaya.

id: kAJcI 11 jagadguru zrI~zivAnanda cidghanEndra sarasvatI ArAdhanA
shlokas:
karNATOjjvalasUnurIzvaravaTuH zritvA surEzaM cirAt
zrIbhASyAdyupalabhya tasya ca dhurAmAsAdya pIThE vasan.
ninyE tatra zivAH (45) samAH ziva iva zrEyO'rthinAM dEhinAM
dAtuM zrEya upAgatO'yamiva yaH zrIcidghanAkhyO babhau..21..
prAptaM kSIrasarittaTAd haririti khyAtaM ca vAtsyAyanaM
pIThE svE vinivEzya dattaniyamaM saJcArya ca prakriyAm.
kalyabdE ca virOdhikRtyanutapaM(paH?) zuddhE dazamyAmagAt
svaM rUpaM paramaM sudhIzatanutaH zrIcidghanazcidghanam..22..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: The boy vara, son of Ujjvala bhaa of Karnataka, known as Cidghana, who approached Surevara and acquired the knowledge of bhyas etc., having got his (Surevaras) responsibility and remaining in the Pha there, this Cidghana spent forty-five years as if iva Himself had come there to grant liberation to those who seek liberation. Revered by the wise, Cidghana having placed Vtsyyna, the initiated who was hailed as Hari arrived from Milky Ocean, and imparting the precepts He had attained his form, the pure consciousness on the tenth day of the bright fortnight in the month of Jyeha in the year Virodhikt of the Kali era.

shlokas:
zrIcidghanEndraniyataH zaradastriSaSTiM zrIkAmakOTim abhimaNDya tatazca kaJcit.
saccidghanAkhyam anuziSya vRtO'pi ziSyaiH zrIcandrazEkharaguruH savapustirO'dhAt..23..
Anandamayam AnandE ASADhyASADhapUrvakE.
navamyAm anavamyaM svaM padam Apat parAtparam..24..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Initiated by r Cidghanendra, the preceptor r Chandraekhara, having adorned the Kmakoi Pha for sixty-three years, then having initiated/ imparted on e named Saccidghana, vanished with form in the midst of disciples. He attained his exalted Supreme state on the ninth day of the bright fortnight in the month of ha of the year nanda.

shlokas:
saptatriMzad asau samAH samanubhUyAcAryapIThIdhurAM
zrIvidyAghanam AndhravarNinam adhAcchrInAyanAkhyaM maThE.
bhrAmyan bAlavad antarE puravarasyA''dhUtavRttiH sthiraH
zrIsaccidghanadEzikaH samabhajat svAntardhim anvIzvaram..25..
sUnuH zrIdharapaNDitasya garuDasrOtasvinItIrabhUH
zESAkhyO gurucandrazEkharamunEH ziSyazca saccidghanaH.
varSAn saptatim Ekavarjam anubhUyAdhyAtmabuddhyA sukhaM
dEhAntE zivaliGgamadhyam avizat kAyAdhirOhEzituH..26..
kharE'kharaprakRtiraghAsahaH sahE parOrajAH param aparE ca pakSakE.
adhAd adhipratipad anApadAspadaM parAtparaM padam azarIram avyayam..27..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Then, the preceptor r Cidghana, having governed or held the responsibilities of crya Pha for thirtyseven years, placed his disciple r Vidyghana, who was known as r Nyana in Prvrama before initiation, in the Maha; adhering to ascetic principles, wandering like a child, He vanished in the divine form of vara. r Sacchidnanda, named ea (before initiation), son of rdhrapaita, born on the banks of river Garua, disciple of Preceptor Chandraekahara having enjoyed the bliss through spiritual practices for sixty-nine years, and at the end of life entered into the ivaligaKydhirohanevara. The great preceptor, the transcendental, immaculate attained the supreme state devoid of pains, beyond everything, imperishable and infinite on the first day of the dark fortnight in the month of Mrgara in the year Khara.

shlokas:
nivEzya gaGgAdharagISpatiM padE pravizya kUTaM tad agastyacihnitam.
pramOTayan mantrata ugrabhairavaM nivEzanaM svaM tata Eva klRptavAn..28..
zrImadbApaNasOmayAjitanayaH zrInAyanAbhikhyayA
khyAtaH pUrvam udAramantravibhavaH saMyamya saccidghanAt.
AsthAyApyadhikAmakOTi sa zivAn (45) abdAn agE'gAllayaM
dhAtau zAli-maNIzikhIkSaNa(239)-sahE darzE ca vidyAghanaH..29..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Having entered the peak named Agastya after established Gagdharagpati in the crya Pha and after subduing the Ugrabhairava through mantra, He stayed there itself. Son of r Boppanna, known as r Nyana earlier, that Vidyghana having got initiation from Saccidghana, endowed with enormous occult powers, having adorned the principal seat of Kmakoi for forty-five years, He merged (in Self) on the new moon day of the month of Mrgara in the year Dhtu of livhana era 239.

shlokas:
sUnurbhadragirEH subhadra iti yaH kAJcya(kapya?)nvayO dvAdazE
varSE saMyamam AzritO'nucaritAd AcAryavidyAghanAt.
zrIgaGgAdharagISpatiH sa ca caturviMzE vayasyAtmavit
zrIvidyAzivayOrnirantaradhRtErApnOt padaM zAzvatam..30..
sarvadhAriNi sa sarvadhArakazcitrazaktiradhicaitram arjunE.
arjunaH svayazasA''dimE dinE'nAdidhAma mahasA jagAma ha..31..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Gagdharagpati, known as Subhadra, son of Kci Bhadragiri, got initiated in the twelfth year of age by r Vidyghana whom He had served became a realised soul when He as twenty-four years old and reached the eternal abode of r vidy and r iva. He, the Omnipotent, omniscient and pure reached the eternal abode by his glory on the first day of the bright fortnight in the month of Caitra of the year Sarvadhari.

id: kAJcI 16 jagadguru zrI~ujjvala zaGkarEndra sarasvatI ArAdhanA
shlokas:
sUnuH kEzavazaGkarasya tapatItIrOdbhavO naiSThikaH
zrImAn acyutakEzavaH zritapadO vaJcIzvarE gISpatEH.
AdEzAt kRtasaMyamazca vimatAn AmUlam unmUlayan
AkAzmIram agAnmahAyatiriti khyAtyOjjvalaH zaGkaraH..32..
aSTAtriMzad athAtivAhya zaradaH pIThE jagaddEzika-
syAsId dig-rasa-vArdhi-vahniSu (3468) kalEryAtsvakSayE'cchE vRSE.
aSTamyAm apaharSazOkam ajaraM brahmaiva yaH zAzvataM
kAzmIrESu kalApurE yadadhunA'pyAkhyAyatE'syAkhyayA..33..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Born on the banks of river Tapati as the son of akarakeavasya and avowed to rigid celibacy r Acyutakeava, known as Ujjvalaakara, after being initiated by Gpati, patronised by Vacavara, uprooted the rival schools and with fame the great saint reached Kashmir. Then having spent thirty-eight years in the Pha of the Universal Preceptor, He merged in Brahman, the eternal free from joy and sorrow and the everlasting on the eighth day of the bright fortnight in Va month of the year Akaya in the Kali era 3468 in the place called Kalpur in Kashmir.

shlokas:
viprAcchrIdEvamizrAd ajani janita EvAptavidyAprakAzaH
saMskAraiH prAktanairyaH samagirata giraM sarvam AtmEti satyam.
tannO mRSyadbhirarhajjinayugabhijanaiH pAtitaH sindhuvENyAM
trAtaH prEmNaiva sindhvA'pyavilayam amuyA padmapatrE nivEzya..34..
sUnuH sO'yaM tapObhistava muditadhiyA dIyatE'dyEti vAcA
sArdhaM dattO dvijAya sthiraniyamayujE yastayaivOhyamAnaH.
puSTastEnAtha puSpAbhidhapurajanuSA bhUrivasvAhvayEna
trAtrA pitrOpanItaH samayam ayam adhAd advayaM nirdvayatvE..35..
AcAryam ujjvalamahAyatizaGkarAryam ArAdhya saMyamam avApya tadAjJayaiva.
zrImAn sadAzivagururvyadhitA'''bdhi yAtrAM sAndOlikaM suvihitAzramavarNadharmaH..36..
nityaM brahmasahasrapOSaNaparaH sarvatra bhASyaM gurOH
saJcArya dvivivarjitAn saniyamaM vArAMzca paJcAzataH.
adhyAsyASTa jagadgurOradhimaThaM varSAn samAdhisthalIM
jIvannEva sadAzivaH samavizat kRtvA surEndraM padE..37..
bhavE bhavAkRtiH sO'cchE jyESThE jyESThastapasvinAm.
dazamyAm Apa dazamIM siddhiM siddhaH sadAzivaH..38..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: The one who was born to a brahmin rdeva Mir; soon after the birth uttered the Truth that everything is tman due to the samskras of the previous birth; the Buddhists and Jains unable to counter the doctrine threw him in the river Sindhu, who saved his life by placing him lovingly on the lotus petals. Being carried by her (river Sindhu) He (Sadivabla) was given to a brahmin endowed with austerities saying pleased by your austerities/penance today this boy/child is given; then being asked/enquired by Bhrivasu of Pushpapura and initiated by himthe saviourfather, He held high the school of nondualism. Preceptor r Sadivabla having served with reverence r Ujjvala akarcrya, got initiation, adhering to the principles of asceticism well carried out voyage in palanquin. Preceptor Sadiva, always intent on feeding one thousand brahmins, moved around everywhere imparted as per injunctions, for fifty times and governing the maha of the Universal Preceptor for eight years, then installing Surendra spent sometime, reached the tranquil state in Tamaraparni (He attained jivasamadhi in Triyambakeshwar.). Sadiva, the great among ascetics, the personification of Lord iva, the accomplished One, attained his final beatitude on the tenth day of the bright fortnight in the month of Jyeha of the year Bhava.

id: kAJcI 18 jagadguru zrI~yOgatilaka surEndra sarasvatI ArAdhanA
shlokas:
durdIdiviM samabhibhUya tathA'sya sAhyAsaktaM ca jIvam apavArya sadhairyam uktyA.
sampUjitaH sadasi rAjasurEndramukhyaiH yOgI surEndraniyamI yuyujE padE svE..39..
mahArASTraH sarvairapi ca vinutO mAthura iti prapannaH sannyAsaM rasa-vasu-jaladhyagniSu (3486) kalEH.
dazaivAdhyuSyAbdAn adhimaTham ayaM yOgitilakaH surEndraH svaM mArgE pratipadi sitE prApa nilayam..40..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: The austere preceptor Surendra after defeating boldly in debate the materialist Durdhivi and his companion Jva, being honoured by King Surendra in his Court merged in his original state. Preceptor Surendra, a Maharashtrian, revered by all as Mdhura, resorted to asceticism, an adept in Yogic practices, governed the Maha for only ten years and reached his abode on the first day of the bright fortnight in the month of Mrgara of the Traa year in the Kali era 3486.

id: kAJcI 19 jagadguru zrI~mArtANDa vidyAghanEndra sarasvatI ArAdhanA
shlokas:
zrIkaNThO'yam umEzazaGkarasutaH zvitrI vayasyaSTamE
nirhantuM gadam anvahaM kRtanamaHsAhasram arkaM bhajan.
zrIvidyAjapatazca nIrujatanurjAtastathA'STAdazE
sannyasyan sa surEndradEzikapadaM prApat prazAntAntaraH..41..
maunI tapaHsvavazamRtyuradhisvapITham abdAMstrayOdaza vihRtya ca zaGkarEndram.
nikSipya dattaguruvAcam alabdha siddhiM saddhEmalambini tathA'hni mahAnavamyAm..42..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: The preceptor rkaha, son of Umea akara, suffering from leprosy, worshipped Srya everyday with a thousand salutations to get rid of the disease and became healthy due to the japa of rvidy, renounced at the age of eighteen and reached with a tranquil mind the holy feet of the preceptor Surendradeika. Avowed to rigoroaus practice of adhering to silence, austere, blessed with a virtue of opting his death day at his will, governed the seat of the Chief of Preceptors for thirteen years and after deputing akarendra with due instructions, reached the beatitude on the ninth day of the bright fortnight in the month of Bhdrapada of the year Hevilambi.

shlokas:
jAtaH khalvATavIrAd gaNakakulamaNEH sAdhu vidyAvatItO
mUkO mUkArbhanAmA bhuvanagurupadAmbhOjarENOrmahimnA.
vyaktaprauDhOktirAptvOpanayanamakhilAmnAyajAtaM ca tAtAd
gRhNan sannyAsam AsIt param adhijagadAcAryapIThaM sa dhIraH..43..
zrIzaGkarEndraH zritamAtRguptam AdhAya varNAzramadharmapAlam.
saikOnaSaSTitrizatE zakE'bdE siddhiM gataH zrAvaNapUrNimAyAm..44..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Dumb boy, as He was named born of Khalvavra, the gem in the family of gaakas, got the ability to speak eloquently through the greatness of (the grace of) the Universal Preceptor, invested with sacred thread, and initiated into the entire scripture by his father and taking up asceticism, He remained in the seat of Universal preceptor. Preceptor akarendra (Arbhakaakara), after installing Mtgupta, the ardent follower of theprecepts of varrama (enjoined for respective classes of people) attained Siddhi on the full moon day in the month of ravaa of the aka year 359. (In the sanskrit and tamil explanations on Pages 22 & 23, Matrugupta appears to be a patron of Sankarendra along with Ramilla, Sri Harsha etc.).

shlokas:
arcAcandanapESaNAd bhagavataH zrIzaGkarEndrArcita-
syArUDhaH padavIM kavEranusRtErharSasya bhUtvA nRpaH.
kAzmIrESu virajya vikrama-mRtau gRhNan gurOH prAktanAt
sannyAsaM sa hi kOGkaNAcyutasutaH zrIcandracUDO'bhavat..45..
abdAn dEvanadItaTE daza nayan AcAryabhUtO bhuvO
dhanvantaryavatAram AryamadhuraM nikSipya pIThE nijE.
dattvA'smai paripUrNabOdhabirudaM bhEjE vyayE cAvyayaM
dhAma svaM jananASTamInizi harEH zrIcandracUDAzramI..46..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Son of r Acyutaarm of Kokaadea, having offered his services of preparing sandal paste for the worship of r Chandramoulvara, He was offered kingship of Kashmir by King Hara for his poetical wisdom/merits. Having ruled Kashmir for a short period, He came back to his preceptor Arbhakaakara and got initiated into asceticism with the name Srvabhauma Chandracendra Sarasvat. Preceptor r Chandracendra Sarasvat leading for ten years a pious life on the banks of Ganges, establishing on his throne revered Madhura the incarnation of Dhanvantari and adorning him with the title Pariprabodha reached/attained his Lords immortal abode on the night of Kajanmam in the year Vijaya.

shlokas:
putrO ramEzamakhinO madhurO'gadaGkRd
grAvAbhilApaka iti prathitazca mantrE.
zrIzAradAmaThaguruH paripUrNabOdhO
raudryUrjazuklanavamIm anu siddhim Arcchat..47..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Son of Ramea Makhin, Madhura, a physician adept in the incatations of Grvbhilpaka, Pariprabodha, the preceptor of r rada Maha attained the beatitude on the night of bright fortnight of the month Kartika in the year Raudri.

shlokas:
zrIcikkAkulasOmaNAryatanayaH sO'yaM girIzaH purA
sannyastaH paripUrNabOdhaguruNA saccitsukhaH SaNmukham.
dhyAyan kAlavidaM sudUram udadhau prOSyAryabhaTTAbhidhaM
pratyAvRttam adhAd athAstikam anuSThApyOditaM niSkrayam..48..
citsukhaM vinivEzya svE padE saccitsukhaH sitE.
kharE kharAMzau vRSagE saptamyAM siddhim Apa saH..49..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Son of r Cikkkula Somanrya, named Gira earlier. initiated with the tile Saccitsukha by Pariprabodha; an ardent devotee of Lord Subrahmanya, He made pious the astrologer ryabhaa by making him carry out the expiatory rite for his long voyage (on sea). He, Saccitsukha, having instituted Citsukha in his place, attained siddhi on the seventh day of the bright fortnight of the month of Vabha in the year Khara.

shlokas:
saccitsukhAcchiva iti prathitO'yam AdAvAdAya zAsanam avartata kOGkaNESu.
AcArya ityabhidhayA paramAryarakSAm AdhAnna tu kvacid agAt padataH padaM saH..50..
aparAbhavO'pi ca parAbhavE sitO'pyanabhasyapIha sa nabhasyathAsitE.
prazamI jagAma dazamIM ca sannasau navamIdinE'bhinavam IzvarAdvayam..51..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Well-known as iva earlier, this Citsukhendra the governor (of the mah) remained in Kokaa; adorning the Preceptorship He was taking care of spiritual activities. He did not move a step from his place. This revered Preceptor ever victorious, the selfrestrained one, merged in the Supreme on the night in the month of ravaa of the year Parbhava.

description.en: The noble son of rka of rmua by name ivasmbha who went round the earth thrice, became a disciple of rcitrukha through initiation, and later became the head of r rada maha. He (r Citsukhendra), whose biography was composed by Mantha in his work titled Siddhajaya adorned the Pha for twenty-one years and attained immortal state. He, the austere, Saccidnandaghana attained immortality in the form of ivaliga on the first day of the bright fortnight in the month of ha of Prabhava year in the aka era 470.

description.en: Then the preceptor Cidvilsa, who was Harikeava (before initiation), son of Madhusdanrya of Hastiaila (Kci) attained his immortal state on the first day of the arat u in the year Durmukhi. The above two impeccable pontiffs Prajghana and Cidvilsa attained siddhi in Kci itself. His (Cidvilsa) duration of preceptorship was thirteen years.

He also attained beatitude in Kci. His preceptorship was for twenty-four years.

description.en: Son of rpati, known as Ka before initiation, the great sage Prabodhendra, merged in Brahman on the Ekdai (eleventh) day of the bright fortnight of the month ravaa in the year vara. His preceptor-ship was for seventeen years.

description.en: The preceptor Blabodhendra was the son of Klahasti, and was called Blaya, bereft of ignorance, attained the Supreme state of immortality on the fourth day of the dark fortnight of the month of Vaika in the year nanda. His preceptor-ship was for thirty-seven years. He attained siddhi in Kci.

description.en: Born on the banks of river Garua (Kailam in Tamil) in the Dravia dea (South India), as the son of Anantrya, He was called Jyearudra (before initiation). Having become the disciple of r Bodhendrcrya, He held with sincerity the responsibility of Preceptor-ship of the earth; worshipped by King Lalitditya of Kashmir who conquered all rival kings on earth r Brahmnandaghana attained liberation on dvda(twelfth day) of the bright fortnight of Jyea in the year Prabhava. Well-versed in the six system of philosophy and adored/worshipped by the well-known poet Bhavabhti and Kashmir monarch Lalitditya, this preceptor adorned the Pha for thirteen years and attained liberation in Kci itself.

description.en: Son of Kaakara, the clever Padmanbha by ame, though intent on practising Lambika Yoga, this preceptor Cidnandaghanendra adhering to the injunctions of the Master, remained in the seat of Kmakoi that bestows all desired things to those who resort to, fed innumerable devotees every day. He, the adept in Yoga reinstating compassionately the Kannada prince who lost kith and kin in his own kingdom through his (the princes) conqueror, He (Cidnandaghanendra) remained as preceptor only for four years sustaining on dry leaves. This preceptor reached his Ultimate abode which is devoid of all grief, delusion etc. on the sixty day of bright fortnight in the month of Mrgara of the year Prajotpati.

description.en: This Saccidnandaghana with a firm control over senses, conversant with various languageswas a Telugu brahmin named Timmaa, son of Prauha Rmaa became the Jagadguru from region on the banks of river Chandrabhga. Renovating the huge dilapidated maha, He remained happily in Kci itself by devoting himself every day in the worship of Goddess Kmk. He, the benevolent great preceptor Saccidnandaghana having travelled upto Himalayas attained liberation on the eighth day of bright fortnight of the month Bhdrapada in the year Khara. He was also known as Bhaparamei and his preceptor-ship was for twenty years.

description.en: The preceptor, son of Mahdeva, who lived on the banks of river Vegavati, known by Lord ivas name, who entered into the dense forest fire to save the child, wandered through out the earth by the directions of his master and adorning the Pha and made the four castes to adhere to their respective paths. The pleasing, elegant and enduring preceptor Sri Chandraekarendra also having remained in his maha for eighteen years disappeared on the new moon day of the month of Mrgara in the year Saumya. His preceptor-ship was for eighteen years.

description.en: Born near the Vedchala mountain as the son of Vimalka and well-known as Sulakamalka, after renunciation became Citsukha; having had the authority of the preceptor-ship of Kci, He lived in the caves of Sahya mountain. He, having installed/deputed Citsukhnanda Yogndra in his place, vanished fully on the sixth day of the bright fortnight of the month of ha of the year Dhtu. His preceptor-ship was for twenty-seven years.

description.en: Son of Somagiri, dwelling on the banks of river Plr (Krapag), known as Surea, (He) became the preceptor. A disciple of r Citsukhendra, disinterest in campaigns/travels, He, on the directions of his preceptor-teacher, remained in the Maha itself. He, the preceptor, r Citsukhnanda attained/ clung on to the state of Bliss on the day of Pauram in the month of Avin of the year Hevilambi. Also known as Cidnanda, He attained siddhi in Kaci itself. His preceptor-ship was for twenty-one years.

description.en: Son of Blacandrasuta named Sryanryaa, r Vidyghanadeika was the disciple of r Cidnanda. The preceptor r Vidyghana, mastering the rvidy held the responsibilities of the preceptor despite the atrocities of Turukas for thirty years. The staunch adherent of asceticism, He reached the highest state of Bliss on the second day of the black fortnight in the month of Puya in the year Prabhava. This preceptor Vidyghana, searching a worthy disciple to adorn the seat of the Pha, reached Cidambaram where He handed over the responsibilities of governing (the Maha) to Dhraakarendra and attained siddhi there itself. His preceptor-ship was for thirty years.

description.en: This preceptor was the son of Vivajit of Cidambaram through vii; like the Sun who dispels the dense darkness veiling his presence, He was born on the tenth day of the bright fortnight in the month of Vaikha in the year Vibhava twelve months after his fathers demise. One who was abandoned as a child in the midst of a forest by his mother herself without any possible solution to her deplorable plight, viz., widowhood, lack of shelter, servitude, insult of relatives fear of slander etc. Who, on crying at a distance was taken by the wife of Vyghrapda, to her home and was compassionately breastfed by her after informing her husband. The sage initiated him and imparted the tmavidy. Then, the adept in self control/ascetic principles, having completed studies, well-versed in scriptures, having received the grace bestowed by the Universal Preceptor (r akara) who manifested of his will before (him), and having received the mighty sacred sandals (of r akara) offered by Padmapda appearing by the side of r akara, He (the Dhraakara) stayed in Tilvaraya. The Universal Preceptor having adorned the seat of KmaPha, He wandered through the earth triumphant of having wiped off the arrogance of the adherents/scholars of rival schools in eight quarters (of the earth) and established the doctrine of Advaita. He akarendra, having conquered easily the Kashmiri scholars Girodbhaa and others, ascended the SarvajaPha in Kashmir and though being followed by disciples to the treya caves (in the Himalayas), disappeared alive in the embodied form itself. Thus, the preceptor sage spreading/showering the tenets of Advaya on this sacred earth for fifty-two years and with a desire to spread this noble path in the other world, He disappeared on the new moon day in the month of ha of the Uttarayaa in the year Siddhrthi of Kali era 3914. The sage Saccidvilsa became the preceptor. This preceptor is turyatta-akara. Some scholars mistake him to be r akara Bhagavadpda and compile biography with inconsistencies.

description.en: Son of Kamalevara rpati, having received the initiation from akara, the sage (preceptor) with an ability to endure heat and cold easily, remained in the guru Pha. Adorned by the erudites like nandavardhana etc., residing at Pamapuram for a long time and then, having reached Kci, He attained siddhi on the night of Narasimha Jayanti in the year Nandana. This saint Saccidvilsa, adored by r nandavardhana, Muktkaa, ivasmi and Rjakaralkara remained in the Pha for thirty-three years and attained siddhi near Kci on the full moon day of Vaika month in the year Nandana.

description.en: Son of Kannayya of Karnataka, ivarmabhaa was placed in the Pha by Saccidvilsayati; resplendent like the Sun, He adorned the Pha and merged in his effulgence on the sixth day of the bright fortnight of Vaikha in the year Bhava. This Ujjvala Mahdevendra remained in the Pha for forty-two years and attained siddhi at Kci itself on the sixth day of uklapaka of Vaikha ,month in the year Bhava.

description.en: Appanna, son of Umeabhaa, on the banks of river Bhm, engrossed in rvidy became preceptor after initiation and remained in KmakoiPha adorning the radphik for thirty-five years. The noble Gagdhara attained siddhi on the pratipad (first day) of bright fortnight in the month ravaa of the year Saumya.

description.en: Then Narasambhaa, son of Subrahmanya, having been initiated by Gagdhara got the appellation Brahmnandaghana held the preceptor-ship of the Pha for twenty-eight years. This great preceptor merged in the Lord vara as He ws teaching the disciples the Brahmastra, bhya etc. in the early morning of Aami of Kapak in the month of Krtika in the year vara.

He left his physical coil on the Navami (ninth day) of the bright fortnight in the month of Caitra of the year Pramdi.

This realised preceptor merged in his illustrious effulgence in the early hours on the trayoda of Kapak in the month Bhdrapada of the year Pramth.

description.en: rkaha, son of ivasmbapaita, known by the appellation Pariva (Paramaiva) (after initiation) who remained in the caves of the mountain since initiation governed the Pha for twenty-one years and having placed poet Somakas son, Srya, in his place, He attained siddhi in the night of saptami of bright fortnight in the Avini month of He year rvari. This preceptor Paramaivendra stayed in the caves of Sahya mountain adhereing to the mode of python (ajagaravtti), restored to by the disciple named Bodhendra, attained siddhi in the Sahya mountain itself.

description.en: He, Soma, initiated with the title Bodhendra by the preceptor Paraivendra adorned the Pha and visiting countries in the palanquin exquisitely decked with gems offered by Bhoja, the king of Dhr, inculcating faith in the principles of Advaita in the minds of those who venerated him on the path safeguarded the Maha from the invaders (mlechas) with the help of the minister of the Kashmiri King Kalaa.  Having stayed in the Pha for thirty-seven years, He reached the Supreme Abode at Arucala on the New moon day of the month ha in the year vara. This preceptor Bodhendra, also known as Snandrnanda, was honoured for poetical excellence by KingsBhoja, Kalaevara and others and was intent on travelling through the earth.

description.en: rkaha, son of ukadevaharma on the banks of the river Kun (Kun) was a drvia (a southerner), eloquent, wellversed in scriptures and courageous; having received the initiation into asceticism from the compassionate preceptor Bodhendra with the name r Chandraca, He held the responsibilities of preceptor-ship on earth by remaining in Kci Maha. This preceptor surrounded by eminent scholarpoets Maka, r Jayadeva, Ka, Suhala, carrying out digvijaya throughout the earth defeated in debate the exponent of Jainism Hemcrya, whose presence embellished the assembly of King Vidylola Kumrapla. This preceptor r Chandraca meditating on the mystic syllable that dispels grief/removes misery, adorning the seat (of preceptor) for sixty-eight years, became Videha by giving up the wondrous physical body on the New moon day in Caitra month of the year Prthiva in the Kali era 4267. This renowned preceptor followed r Jayadeva, Kamira, Suhala and others, adored by King Jayasimha and Kumrapla, destroyed the arrogance of the Jaina exponent Hemcrya and attained the final beatitude at Arucala.

description.en: Stpati, son of Premea, on the banks of river Pinkin, received at the age of seventeen years, initiation into asceticism from preceptor r Chandraca; that eminent preceptor defeated in debates great scholar poets r Harsha, Abhinavagupta and others and wandered three times throughout the earth. This preceptor Cidvilsa, revered by all, spread the tenets of Advaita through his eloquent teachings reached Cidambaram; worshipping the Muktiliga, He disappeared in the air in the very presence of the onlookers all around, on the tenth day of the bright fortnight of Jyeha in the year Siddharthi. This preceptor r Advaitnandabodhendra, also known as the author of Brahmavidybharaavivaraa and other works and a lion to the elephants, viz., refuting the views of r Harsha, Abhinavagupta and others in debates. His preceptor-ship spread over thirty-four years.

shlokas:
chAyAvanAcyutasutO gurumUrtinAmA sthitvA jagadgurupadE chavi(47)varSakAlam.
prAptO'parAbhavapadaM sa parAbhavOrjakAlASTamInizi padaM paramAtmasaMjJam..96..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Son of Chyvana Acyuta, He was Gurumrthi by name (before initiation); having adorned the seat of Jagadguru for forty-seven years, He attained on the night of Klam of the month Krtika in the year Parbhavathe Supreme state denoted by the term Paramtman.

shlokas:
aruNagiritanUbhUrAryagaGgEzanAmA guruvarapadam aJcan kiJca paJcAzadabdAn.
abhajadatha sa siddhiM durmukhijyESThaSaSThInizi nizitazivArcAniSThitazcandracUDaH..97..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Then the preceptor Chandraca, son of Aruagiri, by name Gagea (before initiation), governing the preceptor-ship for fifty years, He, avowed to the rigid worship of Lord iva, attained siddhi on the night of uklapakaahi of the month Jyea in the year Durmukhi. These two preceptorsr Mahdeva and r Jhnavtirthas performed innumerable ygas and attained siddhi on the banks of river Garua (Kailam).

shlokas:
bilvAraNyajazArGgapANitanayaH sarvajJaviSNuH zrayan sannyAsaM gurucandrazEkharamunErAsthAya pIThIM gurOH
yOgEzasya ca cakrarAjavasatErdEvyAzca saktO'rcanE zrImanmAdhavabukkabhAratiyatipraSThairmahiSThairvRtaH..98..

puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Sarvajaviu (name of r Vidytrtha before initiation), son of rgapi) f Bilvaranya received initiation into asceticism from the sage preceptor Chandraekhara; remaining in the seat of the master, engrossed in/attached to the worship of Lord Yogeaand the goddess who dwells in the Cakrarja, He was surrounded by the eminent saintsr Mdhava, Bukka and Bhrati trtha. He decorated the seat by remaining in Kci only for seventy-three years and after directing eight disciples who shone like the presiding deities of eight quarters to take care of the Pha, He, the steadfast one, resorting to the peaks of Himalayas with the only companion disciple, akarnanda, observed severe penance for fifteen years. This preceptor, in the course of penance itself, as the attending disciple was looking at, merged in the Supreme Effulgence of the Sun on the pratipad (first day) of the bright fortnight of the Mgha month in the year raktk. The disciple too afflicted with grief heavily returned to his Maha. In the meantime, the eight disciples too protected the Pha as per the directions; gladdened on seeing the disciple akarnanda, they entered into that Maha of their preceptor. This preceptor, adored by r Vidyraya, Saccidnanda and others is also known popularly as Vidyntha, Vidyea, Vidyakara, Vidytrtha and akarnandaguru.

shlokas:
AdizyASTa yamIzvarAn samavituM karNATadEzE'dvayaM
rOddhuM sAyaNamAdhavOktavidhayA vRddhiM ca madhvAdhvanAm.
vidyAtIrthagurOrasODhavirahO'pyAvRtya zItAcalAt

description.en: He, as per the suggestions of the Syaa Mdhava, having commissioned the eight saints disciples to protect the tenets of Advaita and to check the development of the faith of Madhva in Karnataka, despite the unbearable separation from the master preceptor Vidytrtha, returned from Himalayas and under his (masters) directions held the responsibilities of the Kmakoi Maha. Son of Balacandra Makhi of Madhyrjuna, by name Mahea (before initiation), having received initiation into asceticism from Vidytrtha, popularising among people Advaita among the systems and dispelling the ignorance caused by dvaita, the head of nine Mahas, the Navaakara, headed the Kmakoi Pha for thirty-two years. He the pleasing one, the great preceptor with a sweet speech, the intelligent One, adored by all in the world, shed his physical body on the pratipad of bright fortnight in the month of Vaikha of the year Durmukhi; entered at once into his effulgence. This preceptor r Abhinva akara or akarnanda also known as Navamahntha, was the founder of nine Mahasgeri etc. adept in destroying the schools of Madhva, the one who made the idol Varadarja appear as Lord iva to wipe off the predominance of Vaiavism, adored by the king Bukka, renowned everywhere attained siddhi near Kcipuram. This preceptor is the one who initiated the tradition of rividya mudr.

id: kAJcI 53 jagadguru zrI~pUrNAnanda sadAzivEndra sarasvatI ArAdhanA
shlokas:
nAgAraNyaga-nAganAthatanujaH prAptAzramaH zaGkarAnandAdESa sadAzivEndraniyamI nEpAlabhUpAJcitaH.
pUrNAnandapadEna yO bhuvi punan sarvAMzca sAnugrahaM zrIkAJcyAmadhikAmapIThamavasat saikAmazItiM samAH..105..
piGgalE maGgalAlOkO jyESThE jyESThaH zuciH zucau.
dazamyAM dazamIm Arcchad dazAM dhAmnyapunarbhavE..106..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: This preceptor Sadivendra, son of Ngantha of Ngraya, having got initiation into asceticism from akarnanda, with the title Prnanda, adored by/revered by the King of Nepal, sanctifying all on earth with grace, He stayed at the KmaPha in Kci for eight-one years. The auspicious, revered, pure preceptor merged in the beatitude devoid of rebirth on the tenth day of the bright fortnight of Jyeha month in the year Pigala. This preceptor who went upto Nepal attained Siddhi in Kci itself.

id: kAJcI 54 jagadguru zrI~vyAsAcala mahAdEvEndra sarasvatI ArAdhanA
shlokas:
kAJcIkAmEzvarAryAt samajani kamalAmbOdarAt kuppaNAkhyO
yaH pUrNAnandayOgipravarapadaratEH prApa pIThIm amuSya.
bhASyaM triH saptakRtvazcaTulam acakalad yO navAbdyAM prahRSyan.
 akSayyASADhakRSNapratipadi sa mahAdEvanAmA''pa siddhim..107..

description.en: Born as the son of Kmevara and Kamalmb of Kci, the one named Kupanna who having received the initiation and preceptor-ship with the name Mahdeva, conducted the lectures on Bhya ably for twenty-one times in nine years rejoicingly, attained siddhi on the pratipad of black fortnight in the month of ha of the year Akaya. As He stayed ever in the Vyscala, He is known as Vyscala and the author of Vyscaliya and other works. He attained siddhi in Vyscala.

shlokas:
madhuritamaNimuktAmugdhatIrAzmazAlApuratilakapurArizrImatIpuNyapuJjam.

description.en: Heaps of merits embodied as the son of Purri and rmati of the town Amalapura on the banks of the sweet river Maimukta, Aruagiri governed the preceptor-ship of the Pha surrounded by the four oceans as preceptor candraca. Sri Kapremis edition Thus having imparted the teachings to me, the insignificant disciple and guiding me through various aspects pertaining to the Pha, the preceptor who remained in the Pha for sixteen years and attained siddhi in a moment, He merged in theSupreme Effulgence (of the nature) Saccitsukha devoid of calamities, on the eleventh day of the bright fortnight early morning of the month of Mna of the year Svabhnu at Kaci. Polakam Rmastri edition Thus having imparted the teachings to me, the insignificant among disciples and guiding me through all aspects relating to the Pha, the preceptor who stayed at the Maha for only six years at siddhi in a moment, He merged in the Eternal Bliss, the Supreme Effulgence, devoid of calamities at the dawn of eleventh day of bright fortnight of the Mrgara month in the year grasa at Kaci.

id: kAJcI 56 jagadguru zrI~sarvajJa sadAziva bOdhEndra sarasvatI ArAdhanA
shlokas:
athOttarapinAkinItaTabhavaH sa bOdhEzvaraH sutazcirutacikkaNAdhvarivarasya bhaktO harEH.
abhUt kila jagadgururniyamicandracUDAjJayA sadAzivapadAvahazcara(26)samAH pravIrArcitaH..1..
sa sEtum adhijagmivAn adhipavitrarAmEzvaraM zritaH padam anazvaraM ca prativilambicaitrASTami.
dadhatparamayukchivaM nijapadE pratiSThApitaM zivAya bahulE nRNAM subahulAya pakSE munim..2..
puNyazlOkamaJjarI

description.en: Then, the son of Cirutacikkaddhvari on the banks of river Uttarapinkin, a devotee of Hari, the preceptor Bodhevara, bearing the appellation Sadiva under the directions of preceptor Chandraca, was Jagadguru for sixteen years adored by the King Pravra Sethupati. The preceptor visited the sacred Sethu Rmevara, having worshipped Lord iva for the welfare of the mankind reached eternal abode on Caitra ukla Aam in the year Vilambi. This preceptor is well-known as Sadiva Bodhevara, author of Puyalokamajar and attained siddhi in Rmevaram.

shlokas:
pampAsarastaTabhuvaH paramEzvarasya putraH sadAzivarataH zivarAmakRSNaH.
tasmAdavApya niyamaM niyamI nirastasaGgO'dhyuvAsa sadanaM khalu kAmanEtryAH..3..
zrIcakrapUjanarataH zivayOgalambI zrIdEzikEndravacasA zritakAmapIThaH.

avApad ApadvidhurO dazamyAM dazamyasau dInazakE (1508) zakAbdE..5..

description.en: ivarmaka, son of Paramevara on the banks of river Pamp, devoted to Sadiva, having got initiation into asceticism from him, devoid of any attachment indeed, He remained at the abode of goddess Kmk. Devoted to the worship of r Cakrarja, adhered to the path of ivarja, adhered to the path of ivayoga, adept in worshipping the goddess Kmevar, He, free from desires, held the preceptor-ship for fortyseven years. This senior preceptor, courageous, reached the space that is beyond the physical body, on the tenth day of the bright fortnight of the ravaa month in the year Prthiva of the aka era 1508 (Dra aka). According to scholars, this preceptor was the master of Sadivabrahmendra and attained siddhi in vetrayam.

shlokas:
vRddhAcalaprabhavavizvamakhIndrasUnurvizvEzvaraH parazivAryapadaM prapannaH.
AsEtuzItagiri kalpitajaitrayAtra AdyAt sa zaGkaragurOratihRdya AsIt..6..
vizvAdhikasvadhiSaNatvata EnamAhurvizvAdhikEndram anaghA navazaGkaraM ca.

description.en: Vivevara was the son of Vivamakhindra; resorting to the fact of Paraivrya, known as Navaakara from the first preceptor toured all places successfully, from Setu (Rmevaram) to Stgiri (Himalayas). Since He possessed intellect more than anyone in the Universe, men of wisdom call him Vivdhika and Navaakara. His erudition in composing works such as Rudra bhya is beyond wordsimmeasurable. The preceptor Vivdhikendra carrying out the responsibilities of preceptor for fifty-two years, (later) handing over the responsibilities to Bodhendrrya, and proceeding in southern direction reached eternal abode, meditating on Lord iva with the crescent moon in the crown, on the banks of river Garua on the eighth day of the black fortnight in the month of Tul of the year vara. This preceptor r Navaakara residing on the banks of river Tridaa was revered by eminent men, departed in the southern direction and attained siddhi on the banks of river Garua after handing over the responsibilities to the disciple r Bhagavannma Bodhendra.

id: kAJcI 59 jagadguru zrI~bhagavannAma bOdhEndra sarasvatI ArAdhanA

description.en: This preceptor (r Bhagavannma Bodhendra) under the directions of r Vivdhika came to south; while staying in the house of Jaganntha Kavi, son r Lakmdhara at Jaganntha pini on the shores of Eastern Sea. He sanctified by enjoining expiatory acts based on bhakti to the Brahmin woman polluted/molested by a mleccha. May preceptor sage Bodhendra entering into Kci and embellishing the preceptor-ship, erecting an elaborate path of devotion for the emancipation of all in the Universe by writing excellent works highlighting the concepts (of Bhakti), He who bestowed eloquence even to a dumb child, the ocean with devotees as waves, shine well.Born of Keavapduraga, an eminent scholar of Kavakh, residing in the small village called Maana near Kci, the virtuous devotee, noble (great) in guiding people resorted to him to the path of bhakti, adorned the seat of the great Preceptor, r akara, under the directions of r tmabodha. He carried out preceptor-ship ably in the Maha for fifty-four years and remained in Kmakoi Pha highlighting Advaita through lectures/discourses, the ocean of courage, attained his own non-dual abode in the alivaha era 1614. r Bhagavannma Bodhendra reached the empire of enlightenment near Madhyrjuna Ketra on the full-moon day of the month of Bhdrapda in the year Prajotpatti. That this revered preceptor also known as Yogndra travelled to Rmevaram and on his return attained siddhi at Govindapuram near Madhyrjuna is a well--known fact.

shlokas:
atha vasiSThanadItaTasambhavaH parazurAmasutaH zrutipaNDitaH.
acakalad gururAjadhurAM gurOrvacanatO racayan paritO'Tanam..
AtmaprakAzEndrasamAkhyayA'sAvAcAryakaM dvAdazavarSam Arcchat.
gOvindanAmA niyataH svabhAnucaitradvitIyAnizi siddhimApat..14..

description.en: Then, son of Paraurma on the banks of river Vaiha, well-versed in scriptures, touring all around bore the burden (or preceptor) on him. This sage by name Govinda with the appellation tmaprakendra carried out the responsibilities of preceptor for twelve years. He attained siddhi on the second day of Kapaka in the month Caitra of the year Svabhnu. This preceptor remained in Shahajipuram for a long period hailed as Govindajagadguru by rdhara Vekatea and other learned men.

shlokas:
advaitAtmaprakAzEndrAd bAlya AzritasaMyamaH.
nArAyaNa AdipurE lilyE'nazanatatparaH..6..

mahAyOgI sAkSAtkRtaparamahAH krOdhanasamE tathA jyESThE zuklE navamasutithau siddhim abhajat..7..

description.en: Here (in this world) the best among preceptors by name Mahdevendra adorned the incomparable seat of preceptor for forty-two years; thus the great Yogi realised the Self and attained siddhi on the ninth day of bright fortnight in the month of Jyeha in the year Krodhana. tmabodha, who wrote a commentary Suam on r Sadivabrahmendras Gururatnamlika also belonged to this period (aa contemporary of this preceptor). Only during this period, the Jagadguru Maha moved out of Kci. The place where this present preeptor attained siddhi was the wellknown Tiruvottiyur situated in the north of Madras (alivahana era 1664).

shlokas:

anAma sarvanAmaitad brahmEtIva pradarzayan.

description.en: Preceptor r Chandraekharendra having remained in the Pha for thirty-seven years attained Siddhi on Kadvitya of Puya month in the year Subhakt. r Maha moved to Kumbhaghona town during the period of this crya; his siddhi was also in Kumbhaghona. ivapad, a lyrical work on the model of Gitagovinda of r Jayadeva was composed only by this crya. His siddhi was during alivahana era 1705.

shlokas:
aNNAzrautIti jAtO'yaM kumbhaghONE mahAmanAH.
triSaSTO dEzikO lilyE svagurOrEva sannidhau..12..
mahAdEvEndragururAD EkatriMzatsamAH sthitaH.
zrImukhASADhamAzzukladvAdazyAM siddhim AsthitaH..13..

description.en: Preceptor r Mahdevendra governed the preceptor-ship for thirty-one years, attained siddhi on ukla Dvda (twelfth day of bright fortnight) of the month ha in the year rmukha. His place of siddhi was Kumbhaghona town in alivahana era 1736.

shlokas:
zrImaThapArzvE sadmani jAtO vEGkaTasubrahmaNyatapasvI.
zrIgurupArzvE saMsthitim AgAd uttaravRndAvanavikhyAtaH..14..

description.en: Devoted to Lord Chandramauli, preceptor r Chandraekhara too remaining in the Pha for thirtyseven years reached his eternal abode on the first day of Kapaka in the month of Krthika of the year Sdhraa. The name of this preceptor before initiation was Vekatasubrahmaya Dkita. He was a descendant of the family of Govinda Dkita, wellknown as Ayyan who carried out many righteous acts of prta and adorned the ministerial post in the assembly of King Sevappa Nyaka of the Nyaka dynasty ruling Thanjavur. This preceptor was well-versed in Mantra stra. Only during the period of this preceptor, the renovation or reinstallation of the pair of ear-rings (taaka yugala) symbolic of Sricakra, of Goddess Akhildevar of Jambukevara, renovation of Sricakra in theKmk temple at Kci were carried out. During his visit ot Tanjavur, the preeptor was reverentially coronated with gold or offered Kanakbhieka by the monarch who was ruling Tanjavur. alivahana era 1773.

id: kAJcI 65 jagadguru zrI~sudarzana mahAdEvEndra sarasvatI ArAdhanA
shlokas:
madhyArjunamahAliGganAmA hArItagOtrajaH.

upaSaSTE svavayasi vizramagrAmam AgataH.

virOdhiphAlgunAmAyAM guruH kaivalyam AsthitaH..18..

description.en: Preceptor Mahdevendra adorned the Pha for thirty-nine years and attaind Siddhi on the new moon day in the month of Phlgua of the year Virodhi. This preceptors name before initiation was Mahligam. His parents were well-known as Lakm and edri. His place of siddhi was a village called Ilayttagui. alivahana era 1813.

description.en: Preceptor r Chandraekhara adorned the Pha for seventeen years. He reached his eternal beatitude on the eighth day of the black fortnight in the month of Mgha of the year Parbhava. The name of this preceptor before initiation was Svmintha. Parents were well-known Magalmbik and Strmastri. His place of siddhi was village Kalavai in alivahana era 1830.

shlokas:

description.en: Preceptor by name Mahdevendra adorning Pha attained siddhi on the first day (pratipat) of bright fortnight of Phlguna month in the year Parbhava. The name of this preceptor before initiation was Lakminryaa. His father was well-known as Narasimhastri. This preceptor was well-versed in gveda. His place of sidhi was Kalavai village in alivahana era 1830.

shlokas:
mahAsvAmIti vikhyAtastvaSTaSaSTO jagadguruH.
hArItE'nvaya udbhUta utkRSTE nAma dhAmani..25..

Lord Malayappa rides on Garuda Vahanam in all four mada streets. This usually happens during Brahmotsavams, but since 2006, this has been happening on every `paurNamI`.
`paurNamI vratam` is commonly observed for Lord Satyanarayana.

Vasantotsava is an annual festival conducted for three days (Trayodashi, Chaturdashi and Pournami in the month of Chaitra). During this period, Lord Sri Venkateshwara and His Consorts Sridevi and Bhudevi are taken out in a procession and brought to the Vasanta Mandapam for abhishekam. On the third day, idols of Sri Rama, Sita, Lakshmana, Anjaneya and Sri Krishna (with Rukmini and Satyabhama) are brought to Vasanta Mandapam in procession.

On the first day, Lord Rama with Sita and Lakshmana is offered worship and taken out for a celestial ride on the finely decked float in Swamy Pushkarini. On the second day, Lord Sri Krishna and Rukmini are offered puja and taken for pleasure ride on float. During the remaining three days beginning with Trayodasi and ending with Pournami, Sri Malayappa Swami along with Sridevi and Bhudevi are taken out for a ride in the temple tank. On the third day, there will be three rounds followed by five rounds and on the final day, the utsava murtis will be taken out for pleasure ride on the impressively decorated float for seven rounds.

According to historical evidences, dated 22nd March 1540 CE, the Temple was brought to worship by doing Jeernoddhaarana by Chinni Thirumalacharyulu, the grandson of great saint Sri Talapaka Annamacharyulu. In 1940 CE. an Archaka Swamulu by name Sundararaju from Tamilnadu came to Srinivasa Mangapuram. He shared his dream with villagers by saying that in his dream Lord Venkateswara Swamy appeared and asked him to bring the temple to Past Vaibhavam (glorious) by performing Deepa Naivedya Aaradhana and Lord disppeared. As per the Lord words, Archaka Swami Sundaraju performed first pooja on July 1940 which was coincided on Ashada Shudda Shasti Day with the help of village elders. To mark the auspicious day of revival of Nitya Pooja Kainkaryam, TTD has been conducting this festival as Sakshatkara Vaibhavotsavam on Ashada Shuddha Shasti Day in the Jyaishta month every year.
Padmavati Devi is taken out on the `plava` (last three days).

description.en: Nadha Sharma (`ta:muDavan2{}`, i.e. lame man) and his wife Anavidyambikai came to Mayavaram in order to perform a `tulA snAnam` in Kaveri. However, by the time they arrived, it was the last day of `tulA mAsa` and they could not complete the `snAnam`. They were disappointed yet spent their time doing Puja of the Lord, who appeared in their dreams and asked them to take a bath next morning (1st day of Vrschika) and reap full benefits of the Tula Kaveri Snanam iteself!
